title: Project Allocation Portal
description: The official project allocation portal of IIT Palakkad. It provides a fair allocation of projects to students by considering various parameters.
workDone: Manual project allocation is tiresome and this solution reduces human efforts by over 90%.
Gale-shapley algorithm is used to obtain a fair and stable allocation by considering preferences from both faculties and students.
Currently, most of the streams at IIT Palakkad have switched to using this portal.

title: Meet.me
description: A desktop based collaborative discussion platform with whiteboard, screen-share, analytics and more.
workDone: Led a team of 4 to develop the networking module of the app.
I was responsible for the design specifications and interfacing with other modules.
Used various design patterns for easy interfacing.
Implemented module testing using NUnit.

title: Resource Management System
description: A web and mobile application, mainly developed for managing resources at lab facilities.
workDone: Developed primarily for institute lab facilities, it also generalizes to other resources.
Involves various modules like authentication and authorization, inventory management, advanced booking etc.
Provides a fine-grained control over user authorization with a tree structure capturing admin information.

title: Time Sync
description: An application to assist users regulate screen time with the help of their peers.
workDone: Developed for the final round of Hack-MIT 2020.
Incentives are given to users who spend lesser time on their screen.
Connects user with their peers who can help the user reduce screen time.

title: Tiger Compiler
description: A compiler written in SML for a subset of the tiger language.
workDone: Compiles source code to Intermediate Representation (IR).
Supports multiple data types, operators and recursive functions.
It also provides utility functions like indentation and syntax-highlighting.

title: Driver Attention Analyzer
description: A continuous driver attention analysis system for improved safety.
workDone: This idea was among the top 100 out of 6000 ideas at a hackathon organized by MeitY.
Continuously analyses the driver’s facial expressions.
Low-cost solution optimized for low-power devices such as Raspberry Pi.
Initial version could monitor driver’s facial expressions at 8fps on Raspberry Pi.

title: Driver Assistance System
description: A system for detecting and alerting drivers of upcoming potholes and obstacles.
workDone: Detects obstacles, stores their location and broadcasts this information to other drivers.
Designed to enhance the functionality of google maps by providing obstacle details

title: Malware Detection
description: An application to differentiate between benign and malicious executables.
workDone: Features were extracted from Portable Executable (PE) files and Cuckoo reports.
A random forest classifier was used to classify executables.
Built for the final round of IIT-K HCL Hackathon 2020. Ranked top 100 out of 12,000 teams.

title: DDoS Detection
description: Machine learning application to detect DDoS attacks from pcap files.
workDone: Detects networks involved in DDoS attacks by analyzing packets.
Features were extracted from the logs of pcap files.
K-Nearest Neighbours classifier was detect the attacks.
Built for the final round of IIT-K HCL Hackathon 2020. Ranked top 100 out of 12,000 teams.

title: RISC-V Simulator
description: A pipelined RISC-V processor simulator with support for a large subset of the RISC-V instructions.
workDone: All arithmetic and logical operations are supported.
Supports load-store and partially supports branch operations.
Tested with RISC-V instructions from C programs and assembly.
